description: From Middle English afflicten (attested in past participle afflicte), from Latin afflictāre (“to damage, harass, torment”), frequentative of affligere (“to dash down, overthrow”).

verbs.description: afflict (third-person singular simple present afflicts, present participle afflicting, simple past and past participle afflicted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause (someone) pain, suffering or distress.
(obsolete) To strike or cast down; to overthrow.

examples: Men are apt to prefer a prosperous error before an afflicted truth.
